content.description: Start on the left side of the boulder at a jug. Go straight out to a triangle undercling and other roof holds to get to the jugs on the face. Top out
content.location: On the left side of the cave

content.description: On the left side of the boulder on same start as Twisted Lemon but go left using the massive side pull to get to good holds on the face.
This climb hugs the beautiful arete. Right crimp and left on a sloper. Enjoy the interesting movement.
content.location: This climb is on a separate Boulder from the main Blind Faith Boulder. This Boulder is on the way to Blind Faith and itâ€™s a great warm up.

content.description: Start on a jug rail on the far right side of the cave. Go to edges of the side of the boulder then go straight to the top and top out. It might need to be brushed due to dirt run off.

Amazing climb! This is the center most line in the cave. Start on the lowest jug and go straight out the roof. There is a tricky section using a 2 finger pocket which is hard to see. Hints the name. Bring pads and spotters
content.location:
This area is between the first cluster (The dice area and the School Bus Area). There is a pull of on the right. Look for a stacked rocks/ boulders on the side of the road on your left. Park at the first pull off you see once you see the stacked boulders. Go straight up the hill finding the path of least resistance through the thorn bushes. You will see it at the top of the hill with the distictive red streek down the middle of this amazing boulder. Plug in the GPS coordinates to help you find this amazing boulder. This was the best powerful lines I have ever done.

39.692194N, 79.805107W
